trans-unit.source: Common Parameters and Headers
trans-unit.target: Common Parameters and Headers

trans-unit.source: The following information is common to all operations that you might do related to Batch resources:
trans-unit.target: The following information is common to all operations that you might do related to Batch resources:

trans-unit.source: Replace {api-version} with the api-version in the URI.
trans-unit.target: Replace {api-version} with the api-version in the URI.

trans-unit.source: Replace {account-name} with the name of your Batch account in the URI.
trans-unit.target: Replace {account-name} with the name of your Batch account in the URI.

trans-unit.source: Specify the <legacyItalic>ocp-date</legacyItalic> value as a request header or a URI parameter.
trans-unit.target: Specify the <legacyItalic>ocp-date</legacyItalic> value as a request header or a URI parameter.

trans-unit.source: A date must be specified according to <link xlink:href="#BKMK_DateTime" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values</link>.
trans-unit.target: A date must be specified according to <link xlink:href="#BKMK_DateTime" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values</link>.

trans-unit.source: Specify the optional <legacyItalic>$select</legacyItalic> value as a list of properties to return for a resource.
trans-unit.target: Specify the optional <legacyItalic>$select</legacyItalic> value as a list of properties to return for a resource.

trans-unit.source: Specify the optional <legacyItalic>$skiptoken</legacyItalic> value in the URI if a partial result is returned in a previous operation call.
trans-unit.target: Specify the optional <legacyItalic>$skiptoken</legacyItalic> value in the URI if a partial result is returned in a previous operation call.

trans-unit.source: If the response contains an <legacyItalic>odata.nextLink</legacyItalic> element, the value of the <legacyItalic>odata.nextLink</legacyItalic> element includes a <legacyItalic>$skiptoken</legacyItalic> parameter with a value that specifies the starting point in the collection of entities for the next GET operation.
trans-unit.target: If the response contains an <legacyItalic>odata.nextLink</legacyItalic> element, the value of the <legacyItalic>odata.nextLink</legacyItalic> element includes a <legacyItalic>$skiptoken</legacyItalic> parameter with a value that specifies the starting point in the collection of entities for the next GET operation.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyItalic>$skiptoken</legacyItalic> parameter must only be used on the URI contained in the value of the <legacyItalic>odata.nextLink</legacyItalic> element.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyItalic>$skiptoken</legacyItalic> parameter must only be used on the URI contained in the value of the <legacyItalic>odata.nextLink</legacyItalic> element.

trans-unit.source: Specify the optional <legacyItalic>maxresults</legacyItalic> value in the URI to define the number of items to return in a response.
trans-unit.target: Specify the optional <legacyItalic>maxresults</legacyItalic> value in the URI to define the number of items to return in a response.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of items varies based on the resource:
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of items varies based on the resource:

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 100 certificates can be returned.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 100 certificates can be returned.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 1000 pools can be returned.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 1000 pools can be returned.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 1000 tvms can be returned.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 1000 tvms can be returned.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 1000 workitems can be returned.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 1000 workitems can be returned.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 1000 jobs can be returned.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 1000 jobs can be returned.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 1000 tasks can be returned.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 1000 tasks can be returned.

trans-unit.source: Set the <legacyItalic>Authorization</legacyItalic> header to a string that contains the authentication scheme, the account name, and the authentication signature.
trans-unit.target: Set the <legacyItalic>Authorization</legacyItalic> header to a string that contains the authentication scheme, the account name, and the authentication signature.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="40ee9ee9-9747-43c2-8dbf-1df983c6e7cb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Requests to the Azure Batch service</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="40ee9ee9-9747-43c2-8dbf-1df983c6e7cb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Requests to the Azure Batch service</link>.

trans-unit.source: Set the optional <legacyItalic>client-request-id</legacyItalic> header to a GUID that can be used to identify the request and its related response.
trans-unit.target: Set the optional <legacyItalic>client-request-id</legacyItalic> header to a GUID that can be used to identify the request and its related response.

trans-unit.source: You can also set the optional <legacyItalic>return-client-request-id</legacyItalic> to <legacyBold>true</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>false</legacyBold> depending on whether you want the identifier to be included in the response.
trans-unit.target: You can also set the optional <legacyItalic>return-client-request-id</legacyItalic> to <legacyBold>true</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>false</legacyBold> depending on whether you want the identifier to be included in the response.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <legacyBold>false</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <legacyBold>false</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Representation of Date/Time Values
trans-unit.target: Representation of Date/Time Values

trans-unit.source: Specifying Date/Time values in HTTP headers
trans-unit.target: Specifying Date/Time values in HTTP headers

trans-unit.source: The Batch service follows RFC 1123 for representation of date/time values in headers.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service follows RFC 1123 for representation of date/time values in headers.

trans-unit.source: This is the preferred format for HTTP/1.1 operations, as described in section 3.3 of the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 Protocol Parameters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=133333</linkUri></externalLink> specification.
trans-unit.target: This is the preferred format for HTTP/1.1 operations, as described in section 3.3 of the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 Protocol Parameters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=133333</linkUri></externalLink> specification.

trans-unit.source: An example of this format is:
trans-unit.target: An example of this format is:

trans-unit.source: The following format is also supported, as described in the HTTP/1.1 protocol specification:
trans-unit.target: The following format is also supported, as described in the HTTP/1.1 protocol specification:

trans-unit.source: Both are represented in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), also known as Greenwich Mean Time.
trans-unit.target: Both are represented in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), also known as Greenwich Mean Time.

trans-unit.source: Specifying Date/Time values in URI Parameters and Request/Response Body
trans-unit.target: Specifying Date/Time values in URI Parameters and Request/Response Body

trans-unit.source: Date/time values in query parameters and request/response body are expressed as UTC times and must adhere to a valid ISO 8601 format.
trans-unit.target: Date/time values in query parameters and request/response body are expressed as UTC times and must adhere to a valid ISO 8601 format.

trans-unit.source: Supported ISO 8601 formats include the following:
trans-unit.target: Supported ISO 8601 formats include the following:

trans-unit.source: For the date portion of these formats, <codeInline>YYYY</codeInline> is a four-digit year representation, <codeInline>MM</codeInline> is a two-digit month representation, and <codeInline>DD</codeInline> is a two-digit day representation.
trans-unit.target: For the date portion of these formats, <codeInline>YYYY</codeInline> is a four-digit year representation, <codeInline>MM</codeInline> is a two-digit month representation, and <codeInline>DD</codeInline> is a two-digit day representation.

trans-unit.source: For the time portion, <codeInline>hh</codeInline> is the hour representation in 24-hour notation, <codeInline>mm</codeInline> is the two-digit minute representation, and <codeInline>ss</codeInline> is the two-digit second representation.
trans-unit.target: For the time portion, <codeInline>hh</codeInline> is the hour representation in 24-hour notation, <codeInline>mm</codeInline> is the two-digit minute representation, and <codeInline>ss</codeInline> is the two-digit second representation.

trans-unit.source: A time designator <codeInline>T</codeInline> separates the date and time portions of the string, while a time zone designator <codeInline>TZD</codeInline> specifies a time zone.
trans-unit.target: A time designator <codeInline>T</codeInline> separates the date and time portions of the string, while a time zone designator <codeInline>TZD</codeInline> specifies a time zone.
